item.title: Concurrency and Parallelelism
item.description: We live in a universe where literally every system can multiprocess (Some claim that the universe itself is a parallel system but I’m going to leave that for another blog) but most of our programs are sequential. This is mainly because parallel systems are arduous to design. Concurrent systems grow in complexity exponentially because the more concurrent the system gets, more the places it could fail. Handling for all the failable cases is what makes concurrent design laborious.
